text:
Hello,

FOP Processor: 0.94 - fop.jar
Windows XP

If 2 or more bookmarks have the same internal-destination, the FOP will ignore the previous bookmark and only display the last one. For Example:

<fo:bookmark-tree>
	<fo:bookmark internal-destination="toc-id">
		<fo:bookmark-title>COVER PAGE</fo:bookmark-title>
	</fo:bookmark>
	<fo:bookmark internal-destination="A2345">
		<fo:bookmark-title>WARNING PAGE</fo:bookmark-title>
	</fo:bookmark>
	<fo:bookmark internal-destination="toc-id">
		<fo:bookmark-title>TABLE OF CONTENTS</fo:bookmark-title>
	</fo:bookmark>
</fo:bookmark-tree>

FOP will send a warning:

Mar 21, 2008 7:50:37 AM org.apache.fop.render.pdf.PDFRenderer renderBookmarkItem
WARNING: Bookmark with IDRef "toc-id" has a null PageViewport.

The PDF output will be:

WARNING PAGE
TABLE OF CONTENTS

Desires output:

COVER PAGE
WARNING PAGE
TABLE OF CONTENTS

Both "COVER PAGE" and "TABLE OF CONTENTS" should point to the same internal-destination ("toc-id")

Its unclear to me if this is actually a bug. After reviewing the XSL-1.1 specs I found for the fo:bookmark:

"No area may have more than one normal child area returned by the same fo:bookmark formatting object."

Thank you,

Philip Vallone
creator: philip.vallone@verizon.net

text:
I cannot reproduce your problem. In my tests FOP happily produces multiple bookmarks to the same internal-destination. If you want to pursue this bug report, please investigate the cause of the problem some more, and attach a small fo file that demonstrates the problem.

Simon
creator: spepping@apache.org
tim@tim-landscheidt.de
text:
Created attachment 21793
Test case.

Test case for fop 0.94:

| 8. Apr 08 11:52:01 org.apache.fop.render.pdf.PDFRenderer renderBookmarkItem
| WARNING: Bookmark with IDRef "target1" has a null PageViewport.

and the resulting PDF's table of contents has only "B2" listed.

  The bug already existed in fop 0.93 but at that time a workaround was easy enough for me not to file a report here.

creator: adelmelle@apache.org
text:
Confirmed what Simon discovered. 
So, this is either a WONTFIX (for 0.94) or a FIXED (in 0.95beta).

I opt for the latter. Can you try out 0.95 and see if that resolves your issue? If not for some reason (maybe unrelated to bookmarks), be sure to file a bug against that version.

creator: tim@tim-landscheidt.de
text:
Sorry, I interpreted Simon's comment as "WORKSFORME in 0.94" as the version given for this bug is "0.94".

  Yes, I tried fop 0.95beta and the bug is indeed "FIXED". Thanks!

creator: philip.vallone@verizon.net
text:
Thanks all, I also confirmed this is fixed in fop 0.95beta.

Regards,

Phil

creator: gadams@apache.org
text: batch transition pre-FOP1.0 resolved+fixed bugs to closed+fixed
